students.name: Lena Hoffmann, 22 years old
students.quote: "I had no prior knowledge of IT. Through the training I learned to write clear prompts, automate workflows with AI, and translate team communication into precise tasks. Today I help companies map processes and introduce AI-supported collaboration in a safe and measurable way – and along the way I found my own voice in meetings."

students.name: Aylin Demir, 34 years old
students.quote: "I had no prior knowledge of IT. Through the training I learned how to work with AI – from simple text generation to process automation. What fascinated me most was seeing how the right prompts can steer results. Today I support companies in innovative projects, bring teams together, and show how AI can simplify everyday work, save time, and make new ideas possible."

students.name: Thomas Keller, 45 years old
students.quote: "For a long time I thought that after 40 it was too late to learn something new. But through the training I discovered how exciting data analysis and future technologies can be. Today I develop solutions that help companies become more sustainable, build dashboards and analyze connections. I now use my accounting experience to create structures that make both ecological and economic sense – and I have restarted my career."

students.name: Yevhen Reitarov, 42 years old
students.quote: "Before the training I never thought I would be able to program my own apps. Today I develop APIs, build user interfaces in React, and write tests that provide security – in an international team, in both English and German. I replaced the feeling of being an 'impostor' with projects, code reviews, and daily practice."

students.name: David Johnson, 25 years old
students.quote: "I always dreamed of working in tech but didn’t know where to begin. Through the training I learned programming, cloud infrastructure, and IT security. Today I design cloud solutions, automate deployments, and help companies scale securely. This journey taught me: determination and learning open doors."

questions.q: I have no prior knowledge – can I still get started?
questions.a: Yes, absolutely! Our programs are designed so that you learn everything step by step from the ground up. No prior experience is required – motivation and willingness to learn are more than enough.

questions.q: Am I too old to start training in future-oriented professions?
questions.a: No! In the tech industry, age doesn’t matter – what counts is the ability to learn new things. Many of our graduates successfully started their careers at 30, 40, or even 50.

questions.q: What are my job prospects after completing the training?
questions.a: Very good! Specialists in IT and digitalization are in high demand. With our hands-on projects and certificates, you’ll significantly increase your chances of finding a job quickly.

questions.q: How practical is the training? Will I work on real projects?
questions.a: Yes! From the very beginning, you’ll work on practical tasks and projects that prepare you optimally for everyday work. This way, you can immediately apply your knowledge.

questions.q: How much time do I need to invest per week?
questions.a: Plan on around 8–10 hours per week. The program is designed flexibly so you can adapt your learning time to your daily routine.

questions.q: Can I do the training alongside my job?
questions.a: Yes, our training is designed so that you can complete it part-time. Many participants study in the evenings or on weekends – completely flexible.
